stem: A patient with chronic kidney disease (CKD) is prescribed epoetin alfa. Which laboratory value is MOST important to assess before administering this medication?

itemContext.sbar: John Smith is a 68-year-old male with a history of CKD. He is being started on epoetin alfa to manage his anemia.

rationale.correct: Iron levels must be adequate for epoetin alfa to be effective. Epoetin stimulates red blood cell production, which requires iron. If iron stores are low, the medication will not work effectively.
rationale.incorrect: While potassium, BUN, and creatinine are important to monitor in CKD, they are not the MOST important to assess before administering epoetin alfa. Epoetin alfa stimulates red blood cell production, which requires iron. If iron stores are low, the medication will not work effectively.
clinicalPearls: Epoetin alfa stimulates red blood cell production.
Adequate iron stores are essential for the effectiveness of epoetin alfa.
rationale.questionTrap: Students may focus on general CKD labs (potassium, BUN, creatinine) instead of the specific requirement for iron when administering epoetin alfa.
